result.markdown:
# Introduction

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

See @knuth84 for additional discussion of literate programming.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(brms)
library(tidybayes)
library(marginaleffects)
```
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
model <- brm(
  bf(body_mass ~ species),
  data = penguins,
  family = gaussian(),
  chains = 4, warmup = 1000, iter = 2000, seed = 1234,
  backend = "cmdstanr", cores = 4, threads = threading(2)
)
```
:::


Here's @fig-bayes-results:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
model |> 
  predictions(newdata = datagrid(species = unique)) |> 
  get_draws() |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = draw, y = fct_rev(species), fill = species)) + 
  stat_halfeye() + 
  guides(fill = "none") +
  scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "turbo", begin = 0.1, end = 0.9) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](intro_files/figure-pdf/fig-bayes-results-1.pdf){#fig-bayes-results fig-pos='H'}
:::
:::
